intro: Acisanthera variabilis var. glabriuscula, commonly known as the smooth acisanthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and disturbed sites. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
